snippet: General Videla was serving a life sentence for abuses in a campaign of political killings and forced disappearances during Argentina’s so-called Dirty War.
abstract: Jorge Rafael Videla, jailed military junta leader of Argentina, dies at age 87.

byline.contributor: Simon Romero contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: General Videla was serving a life sentence for abuses in a campaign of political killings and forced disappearances during Argentina’s so-called Dirty War.

headline.seo: Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentina Military Leader in ‘Dirty War,’ Dies at 87
headline.main: Jorge Rafael Videla, Jailed Argentine Military Leader, Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: Jorge Rafael Videla, Jailed Military Junta Leader of Argentina, Dies at 87

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
